page.title: 04LOCAL AMENITIES AT BROUGHTON
page.content: {EDUCATION.}THE VILLAGE SCHOOL CLOSED IN 1981 AND ALL CHILDREN NOW LEAVE THE VILLAGE TO GO TO SCHOOL. SEVERAL GO TO PRIVATE DAY OR BOARDING SCHOOLS AND THE MAJORITY ARE TAKEN DAILY BY BUS TO ECCLESHALL JUNIOR AND MIDDLE SCHOOLS OR TO STAFFORD SENIOR SCHOOLS. {TRANSPORT}THE ONLY PLUBIC TRANSPORT IS A TWICE-WEEKLY BUS TO STAFFORD AND ONE BUS PER WEEK TO MARKET DRAYTON.ALL PEOPLE WORKING OUTSIDE THE AREA USE THEIR OWN TRANSPORT. {MEDICAL.}THERE ARE NO DOCTORS IN BROUGHTON AREA.MOST PEOPLE ATTEND TWO DOCTORS IN ECCLESHALL OR THE HEALTH CENTRE AT ASHLEY.THE HOSPITALS SERVING THE AREA ARE NORTH STAFFS ROYAL INFIRMARY AND STAFFORD DISTRICT HOSPITAL.SHOPS.THE ONLY SHOP IN BROUGHTON CLOSED SOME YEARS AGO AND THE VILLAGE POST OFFICE CLOSED IN 1983,ONLY PILLARBOX REMAINING NO PHONE
